MONL.content: “the loving and jealous vengeance of a new work of training [dressage], restore and reinvent language”
MONL.linkedContent: “the loving and jealous vengeance of a new work of training [dressage], restore and reinvent language”

SPOM.content: the address “I’m going to teach you to live,” from lips of master, father to son > hesitates btwn address as experience, as education, as taming or training (dressage)
SPOM.linkedContent: the address “I’m going to teach you to live,” from lips of master, father to son > hesitates btwn address as experience, as education, as taming or training (dressage)

POR.content: via Aristotle, knowledge as knowing to learn and to teach
POR.linkedContent: via Aristotle, knowledge as knowing to learn and to teach

POR.content: sight is privileged sense re: knowledge, knowing for sake of knowing linked to sight as senseless sensation (sight privileged even when no praxis in view)
POR.linkedContent: sight is privileged sense re: knowledge, knowing for sake of knowing linked to sight as senseless sensation (sight privileged even when no praxis in view)

POR.content: bees, Aristotle says they can’t learn because they can’t hear

POR.content: for Aristotle, theoretician leader possessing logos knows how to teach, how to lead, how to command
POR.linkedContent: for Aristotle, theoretician leader possessing logos knows how to teach, how to lead, how to command

HERP.content: Heidegger [on Bildung]: community of struggle (Kampfgemeinschaft) a struggle that holds opposition open, permits resolute self-examination [only the “few”] [see p. 190]
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger [on Bildung]: community of struggle (Kampfgemeinschaft) a struggle that holds opposition open, permits resolute self-examination [only the “few”] [see p. 190]

HASD.linkedContent: [re: negative theology] a politics of initiation or teaching, multiplication of voices, veil dissimulates & renders attractive at same time [Augustine: God is powerful w/out power]

HASD.linkedContent: agogic path [askesis] of a text [Dionysus to Timothy]: repetition or repeatability

PP.content: [in your soul (en tēi psuchēi), like a mantra, an education]
PP.linkedContent: [in your soul (en tēi psuchēi), like a mantra, an education]

PP.content: seed must submit to logos, do violence to itself, since sperm is opposed to law of logos > when Plato turns live speech into psychic graphē he does so w/ a problematic of truth: l’écriture en tè psuchè n’est pas une écriture de frayage, mais seulement d’enseignement, de transmission, écriture d’aletheia
PP.linkedContent: seed must submit to logos, do violence to itself, since sperm is opposed to law of logos > when Plato turns live speech into psychic graphē he does so w/ a problematic of truth: l’écriture en tè psuchè n’est pas une écriture de frayage, mais seulement d’enseignement, de transmission, écriture d’aletheia

PP.content: Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy
PP.linkedContent: Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy

POOF.content: the pledge (la parole donnée) before the living dead must recall the political principle: politeía forms men, it’s not a consequence of this aristocratic equalization > politics is that which forms men, regulates itself in its laws re: nature, eugenics, education
POOF.linkedContent: the pledge (la parole donnée) before the living dead must recall the political principle: politeía forms men, it’s not a consequence of this aristocratic equalization > politics is that which forms men, regulates itself in its laws re: nature, eugenics, education

POOF.content: acc. Heidegger, Christianity is an education of passions, even a psychology, a psychological subjectivity—all post-Aristotelian friendships are Christian, same goes for ‘politics’
POOF.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Christianity is an education of passions, even a psychology, a psychological subjectivity—all post-Aristotelian friendships are Christian, same goes for ‘politics’

FWT.content: training as a form of cloning

DS.content: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play

P.content: Hegel’s Lectures on Aesthetics: system of training for teaching and cycle of knowledge
P.linkedContent: Hegel’s Lectures on Aesthetics: system of training for teaching and cycle of knowledge

P.content: metaphor of circle of circles, of training (Bildung) as philosophical encyclopedia
P.linkedContent: metaphor of circle of circles, of training (Bildung) as philosophical encyclopedia

ROP.content: Freud’s link to all disciplines that question analysis: teaching, teaching philosophy, and (w/ its concern for truth & avowal) confession
ROP.linkedContent: Freud’s link to all disciplines that question analysis: teaching, teaching philosophy, and (w/ its concern for truth & avowal) confession

OTO.content: strict adherence to classical pedagogy (whose imperatives one can never break from once and for all) would reduce you to silence, tedium, tautology
OTO.linkedContent: strict adherence to classical pedagogy (whose imperatives one can never break from once and for all) would reduce you to silence, tedium, tautology

OTO.content: for Nietzsche, culture (Bildung) begins when we know how to treat the living as living; Derrida discusses a pact, alliance, contract, a hymen w/ living language, w/ mother (tongue), against death (father): even good master of history (science of the father) trains for the sake of mother tongue, must know when to suppress ‘historical interest’ for culture to begin
OTO.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, culture (Bildung) begins when we know how to treat the living as living; Derrida discusses a pact, alliance, contract, a hymen w/ living language, w/ mother (tongue), against death (father): even good master of history (science of the father) trains for the sake of mother tongue, must know when to suppress ‘historical interest’ for culture to begin

OTO.content: Nietzsche: rights of genius have been democratized, so everyone is relieved of the labor to form oneself
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche: rights of genius have been democratized, so everyone is relieved of the labor to form oneself

OTO.content: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]
OTO.linkedContent: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]

OTO.content: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]
OTO.linkedContent: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]

OTO.content: Nietzsche: culture (Bildung) begins w/ obedience (Gehorsamkeit), subordination (Unterordnung), discipline (Zucht), not academic freedom
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche: culture (Bildung) begins w/ obedience (Gehorsamkeit), subordination (Unterordnung), discipline (Zucht), not academic freedom

OTO.content: the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny
OTO.linkedContent: the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny

OTO.content: no trace of woman in State education system, she is the great “cripple,” not even attached to the [State] umbilical cord > Derrida does not say this to seduce, a vulgar procedure, and a ubiquitous one, “gynegogy”
OTO.linkedContent: no trace of woman in State education system, she is the great “cripple,” not even attached to the [State] umbilical cord > Derrida does not say this to seduce, a vulgar procedure, and a ubiquitous one, “gynegogy”

OTO.content: except the mother, there’s a mother in this system (faceless figure, survives on bottom)
OTO.linkedContent: except the mother, there’s a mother in this system (faceless figure, survives on bottom)

ATIA.content: one should try not to repeat oneself, it gives appearance of training (dressage), of following a program
ATIA.linkedContent: one should try not to repeat oneself, it gives appearance of training (dressage), of following a program

ATIA.content: man names the animals to dominate, domesticate, train them
ATIA.linkedContent: man names the animals to dominate, domesticate, train them

ATIA.content: vous entraîner à ma suite “train you to follow me, drag you after me” in coordination w/ hunting him (Derrida) down through labyrinths
ATIA.linkedContent: vous entraîner à ma suite “train you to follow me, drag you after me” in coordination w/ hunting him (Derrida) down through labyrinths

ATIA.content: transgressal experience of limitrophy, trephō, trophē, trophos: to feed limit, train, nurse, make grow, thicken, fold, divide the line, multiply/increase limit’s figures [not efface the limit]
ATIA.linkedContent: transgressal experience of limitrophy, trephō, trophē, trophos: to feed limit, train, nurse, make grow, thicken, fold, divide the line, multiply/increase limit’s figures [not efface the limit]

Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s question of technology presented as protest, barely disguised condemnation of professionalization of University studies during Nazi regime

PIO.content: no invention w/out advent, singular structure of event, makes come about what is new in a “first time ever,” [cf. première fois] inauguration of a possibility/power at disposal of everyone, thus conventions, belonging to a culture (heritage, pedagogical institution, discipline)
PIO.linkedContent: no invention w/out advent, singular structure of event, makes come about what is new in a “first time ever,” [cf. première fois] inauguration of a possibility/power at disposal of everyone, thus conventions, belonging to a culture (heritage, pedagogical institution, discipline)

PIO.content: invention begins by being susceptible to repetition, exploitation, reinscription
PIO.linkedContent: invention begins by being susceptible to repetition, exploitation, reinscription

WAP (P).content: the 3 meanings of du droit à la philosophie, the 4th: can we go right to philosophy, do we need training; adverbial “right” enriches & overdetermines other meanings [?]
WAP (P).linkedContent: the 3 meanings of du droit à la philosophie, the 4th: can we go right to philosophy, do we need training; adverbial “right” enriches & overdetermines other meanings [?]

WAP (P).content: is the “people” [of philosophy?] a given or a horizon of a training?
WAP (P).linkedContent: is the “people” [of philosophy?] a given or a horizon of a training?

WAP (P).content: time of teaching as time of training (formation) > lodges itself in fold of already and not yet
WAP (P).linkedContent: time of teaching as time of training (formation) > lodges itself in fold of already and not yet

WAP (P).content: Kant’s maxim is not the law, it is the subjective relation to the law, rule of action in conformity w/ law > teaching/training thus administered at level of maxim
WAP (P).linkedContent: Kant’s maxim is not the law, it is the subjective relation to the law, rule of action in conformity w/ law > teaching/training thus administered at level of maxim

WAP (P).content: drawing one’s authority from oneself, and thus from Kant; Kant’s heritage has been tattooed in, privileged inscription of an absolute privilege, quasi-naturalized right in its training, a norm, a program > Kant authorizes/authenticates dignity of “great” philosophy (even if it’s speaking against him) [to ignore Kant would be to succumb to Kant]
WAP (P).linkedContent: drawing one’s authority from oneself, and thus from Kant; Kant’s heritage has been tattooed in, privileged inscription of an absolute privilege, quasi-naturalized right in its training, a norm, a program > Kant authorizes/authenticates dignity of “great” philosophy (even if it’s speaking against him) [to ignore Kant would be to succumb to Kant]

WAP (P).content: Kant’s discourse as a (proposed) pedagogy—professional right of philosophy: legitimacy of its objective constraint
WAP (P).linkedContent: Kant’s discourse as a (proposed) pedagogy—professional right of philosophy: legitimacy of its objective constraint

WAP (P).content: onto-theological, phallogocentric principles of metaphysics guided by question “what is?” subordinates all fields to onto-encyclopedic instant: leads to unity of philosophical university
WAP (P).linkedContent: onto-theological, phallogocentric principles of metaphysics guided by question “what is?” subordinates all fields to onto-encyclopedic instant: leads to unity of philosophical university

WAP (P).content: a university is always the construction of a philosophy
WAP (P).linkedContent: a university is always the construction of a philosophy

WAP (P).content: Derrida, who has to act sometimes as if his published work doesn’t exist, talks about a fictive zero point in a seminar: a repetition and a “complete beginning”
WAP (P).linkedContent: Derrida, who has to act sometimes as if his published work doesn’t exist, talks about a fictive zero point in a seminar: a repetition and a “complete beginning”

WAP (P).content: chaque pas est toujours piégé, defending philosophy, destroying philosophy, using fragmentary, aphoristic, elliptical language > each can serve most violent didacticism
WAP (P).linkedContent: chaque pas est toujours piégé, defending philosophy, destroying philosophy, using fragmentary, aphoristic, elliptical language > each can serve most violent didacticism

WAP (TB).content: as a didactic technique, teaching becomes organon of repetition, teaching as history of the sign > teaching body lives from belief in transcendental signified, which comes back to life, more and better, w/ authority of transcendental phallus (signifier of signifiers)
WAP (TB).linkedContent: as a didactic technique, teaching becomes organon of repetition, teaching as history of the sign > teaching body lives from belief in transcendental signified, which comes back to life, more and better, w/ authority of transcendental phallus (signifier of signifiers)

WAP (TB).content: toute université met le langage dans cette position de retard ou de dérivation par rapport au sens ou à la vérité > w/ signifier of signifier teaching structure (belatedness) given a second wind (souffle) >
WAP (TB).linkedContent: toute université met le langage dans cette position de retard ou de dérivation par rapport au sens ou à la vérité > w/ signifier of signifier teaching structure (belatedness) given a second wind (souffle) >

WAP (TB).content: move from learning authors to learning questions is not more liberating
WAP (TB).linkedContent: move from learning authors to learning questions is not more liberating

WAP (TB).content: Condillac’s ideological, revolutionary discourse on teaching body
paideia as auto-encyclopedia > teacher effaces himself so student can begin again [Condillac]
WAP (TB).linkedContent: paideia as auto-encyclopedia > teacher effaces himself so student can begin again [Condillac]

WAP (TB).content: acc. Napoleon, teachers should be single men
WAP (TB).linkedContent: acc. Napoleon, teachers should be single men

WAP (TB).content: maîtres-assistants contradiction or breach (brèche) in teaching body > always in places of this kind that front has best chance of establishing itself
WAP (TB).linkedContent: maîtres-assistants contradiction or breach (brèche) in teaching body > always in places of this kind that front has best chance of establishing itself

WAP (TB).content: [speaking of teaching body] hear I am, the teaching body, in what way is this a glorious body? all light on me > it is also glorious because no longer a body: sublimated, at once part/whole of general teaching body, representative of philosophical/sociopolitical corpus
WAP (TB).linkedContent: [speaking of teaching body] hear I am, the teaching body, in what way is this a glorious body? all light on me > it is also glorious because no longer a body: sublimated, at once part/whole of general teaching body, representative of philosophical/sociopolitical corpus

WAP (TB).content: teaching body fascinates when it’s more than a center: its excentricity permits synoptic surveillance covering field of (indistinguishable) body taught & permits withdrawal, reserve, of body that does not surrender, offering itself from only one side [visor effect?]
WAP (TB).linkedContent: teaching body fascinates when it’s more than a center: its excentricity permits synoptic surveillance covering field of (indistinguishable) body taught & permits withdrawal, reserve, of body that does not surrender, offering itself from only one side [visor effect?]

WAP (TB).content: body becomes teaching and exercises mastery by a stratified erasure in front of/behind the corpus taught
WAP (TB).linkedContent: body becomes teaching and exercises mastery by a stratified erasure in front of/behind the corpus taught

WAP (TB).content: moral & political system forms the object & actualized structure of pedagogy
WAP (TB).linkedContent: moral & political system forms the object & actualized structure of pedagogy

WAP (CT).content: philosophy is ontology, its paideia an encyclopedia
philosophy always conceived w/ dialectico-pedagogical relation to “teaching”
WAP (CT).linkedContent: philosophy always conceived w/ dialectico-pedagogical relation to “teaching”

WAP (CT).content: since 19th century, structure of teaching philosophy has been nationalized
WAP (CT).linkedContent: since 19th century, structure of teaching philosophy has been nationalized

WAP (CT).content: to not advance a philosophical training/teaching due to suspicion of “progressivity” gives credence to a mystifying argument (mystifying and w/out future)
WAP (CT).linkedContent: to not advance a philosophical training/teaching due to suspicion of “progressivity” gives credence to a mystifying argument (mystifying and w/out future)

WAP (AH).content: how old should a student be before they are taught philosophy?
WAP (AH).linkedContent: how old should a student be before they are taught philosophy?

WAP (AH).content: GREPH risks primitive desire, naturalistic mystification: self-effacing teacher places truth in student, always ready (naturally) to philosophize, an invisible writing upon pupil body
WAP (AH).linkedContent: GREPH risks primitive desire, naturalistic mystification: self-effacing teacher places truth in student, always ready (naturally) to philosophize, an invisible writing upon pupil body

WAP (AH).content: most durable tradition of philosophical teaching: revelation, unveiling, discovered truth of “already there (déjà la)” acc. mode of “not-yet (pas encore),” unveiling: Socrato-Platonic anamnesis or even neo-Heideggerian philosophy of psychoanalysis [Lacan?]
WAP (AH).linkedContent: most durable tradition of philosophical teaching: revelation, unveiling, discovered truth of “already there (déjà la)” acc. mode of “not-yet (pas encore),” unveiling: Socrato-Platonic anamnesis or even neo-Heideggerian philosophy of psychoanalysis [Lacan?]

WAP (AH).content: childhood as pure memory, not yet speculation; young Hegel, very gifted, an example (pour example), the essence of a possibility, not exemplary (en example): all children should be able like young Hegel to play role, figure, of moment in pedagogy of the mind
WAP (AH).linkedContent: childhood as pure memory, not yet speculation; young Hegel, very gifted, an example (pour example), the essence of a possibility, not exemplary (en example): all children should be able like young Hegel to play role, figure, of moment in pedagogy of the mind

WAP (AH).linkedContent: the “pas-encore du déjà” of young Hegel, a stage of understanding before speculation, thus forbidding what Hegel seems to be promoting: teaching philosophy in the Gymnasium

WAP (AH).linkedContent: current mode of productive spontaneity (independent, living self-discovery) & the old monotonous, mnemotechnical pedagogy both make of a child more abstract than the adult

WAP (AH).linkedContent: age of formalism & quantitative technique: “incapable childhood (unvermögende Kindheit)”

WAP (AH).content: [how can a pedagogical formula avoid blind spot, thus rightfully accused of babble, hollowness?]

WAP (AH).linkedContent: Hegel’s pedagogy: privileging the memorization of content over form and wrest religious instruction from religion > bring it into speculative thought

WAP (AH).content: Hegel, Heidegger, Nietzsche all against utilitarian pedagogy

WAP (PC).content: myth that all philosophy is impossible before “adolescence,” figure of 15-18 year old man, virgin yet fully grown: ripe for philosophy; the adult philosopher, as Callicles says in Gorgias: “unmanly & worthy of a beating”
WAP (PC).linkedContent: myth that all philosophy is impossible before “adolescence,” figure of 15-18 year old man, virgin yet fully grown: ripe for philosophy; the adult philosopher, as Callicles says in Gorgias: “unmanly & worthy of a beating”

Socratico-transferential: interminable training from same teacher one’s entire life
WAP (DB).linkedContent: Socratico-transferential: interminable training from same teacher one’s entire life

IW.content: via Cohen, need for pedagogy: awaken what is asleep in logocentered psyche
IW.linkedContent: via Cohen, need for pedagogy: awaken what is asleep in logocentered psyche

+R.content: resonances leading you astray, what if I like words in order to be-tray (pour trahir) > (pour traiter, triturer, traîner, tramer, tracer, traquer)
+R.linkedContent: resonances leading you astray, what if I like words in order to be-tray (pour trahir) > (pour traiter, triturer, traîner, tramer, tracer, traquer)

TN.content: untouchable before vow of abstinence [cf. OG p. 109 spacing prior to prohibition of names]? a vow of abstinence requires promise of touch > touch haunting abstinence itself, intensifying transgression: unforgivable perjury at heart of interdict
TN.linkedContent: untouchable before vow of abstinence [cf. OG p. 109 spacing prior to prohibition of names]? a vow of abstinence requires promise of touch > touch haunting abstinence itself, intensifying transgression: unforgivable perjury at heart of interdict

TN.linkedContent: for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure

TN.content: “transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism
TN.linkedContent: “transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism

TN.content: Ravaisson: good habit as return to innocence through training
TN.linkedContent: Ravaisson: good habit as return to innocence through training

AD.content: Levinas proposes a teaching via welcoming that gives/receives something else, not ruse of master who feigns effacement behind figure of midwife
AD.linkedContent: Levinas proposes a teaching via welcoming that gives/receives something else, not ruse of master who feigns effacement behind figure of midwife

AD.content: maieutics, stuck in the same, teaches me nothing, only what is already in myself: même, egomet ipse, medisme, pouvoir savoir, property, gathers in itself (rassemble en lui-même) capacity & knowing
AD.linkedContent: maieutics, stuck in the same, teaches me nothing, only what is already in myself: même, egomet ipse, medisme, pouvoir savoir, property, gathers in itself (rassemble en lui-même) capacity & knowing

AD.linkedContent: Levinas’ open door calls for the opening of an exteriority or of a transcendence of the idea of infinity > idea comes through the door: the door passed through is reason in teaching

AD.linkedContent: Levinas refers to Aristotle: agent intellect discovers knowledge coming in by the door > [Levinas sees reception in this transitivity, an absolute exteriority not found in maieutics]

AD.content: Levinas gives teaching magisterial height: teaching what “to welcome,” “to receive”
AD.linkedContent: Levinas gives teaching magisterial height: teaching what “to welcome,” “to receive”

CIN.content: Woolf: “incarnadine the willows…for we have done with this ‘education’!”
CIN.linkedContent: Woolf: “incarnadine the willows…for we have done with this ‘education’!”

BSi.content: “storytelling,” convention of some historical as if, fabular > a moral lesson, a political strategy, pedagogical artifice to credit a fable: to make known (political logic, rhetoric)
BSi.linkedContent: “storytelling,” convention of some historical as if, fabular > a moral lesson, a political strategy, pedagogical artifice to credit a fable: to make known (political logic, rhetoric)

BSi.content: fabular dimension of political not just sayings or writings but actions > death & suffering inscribed in affabulatory score (on Television): put living beings on stage to accredit interpretation of narrative, to faire savoir, like Augustine’s making truth, veritatem faciare
BSi.linkedContent: fabular dimension of political not just sayings or writings but actions > death & suffering inscribed in affabulatory score (on Television): put living beings on stage to accredit interpretation of narrative, to faire savoir, like Augustine’s making truth, veritatem faciare

BSi.content: D.H. Lawerence: “I despised myself and the voices of my accursed human education”
BSi.linkedContent: D.H. Lawerence: “I despised myself and the voices of my accursed human education”

BSi.content: nomos of oikos: taming, training > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity of sovereign mastery

OG.content: Rousseau advocates a kind of natural supplement w/ culture, a suppléance, habit, pedagogy, as necessary and insufficient to reconstitute wholeness of mother nature
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau advocates a kind of natural supplement w/ culture, a suppléance, habit, pedagogy, as necessary and insufficient to reconstitute wholeness of mother nature

OG.content: childhood first call for suppléance, first manifestation of deficiency, pedagogy crudely shows the paradox of supplement
OG.linkedContent: childhood first call for suppléance, first manifestation of deficiency, pedagogy crudely shows the paradox of supplement

OG.content: slow place of pedagogy, Nature takes her time, outpaced by immediacy of dangerous supplement which burns the halting points (brûle les étapes), consumes l’énergie sans retour
OG.linkedContent: slow place of pedagogy, Nature takes her time, outpaced by immediacy of dangerous supplement which burns the halting points (brûle les étapes), consumes l’énergie sans retour

OG.content: (292, 292n) teach by example or explanation? but will the child do it by heart or memory? is there virtue in imitating virtue? [Kant, Rousseau]
OG.linkedContent: (292, 292n) teach by example or explanation? but will the child do it by heart or memory? is there virtue in imitating virtue? [Kant, Rousseau]

EU.content: for Schelling, philosopher develops negative condition: consciousness of inanity of all finite knowledge > ability to translate, re-translate, the real to the ideal can be acquired—can be cultivated in a Bildung and become untransformable habitus, unalterable organ
EU.linkedContent: for Schelling, philosopher develops negative condition: consciousness of inanity of all finite knowledge > ability to translate, re-translate, the real to the ideal can be acquired—can be cultivated in a Bildung and become untransformable habitus, unalterable organ

EU.content: acc. Kant, all pedagogy gives conclusions w/out principle: place of passage, access to results of a thought elaborated
EU.linkedContent: acc. Kant, all pedagogy gives conclusions w/out principle: place of passage, access to results of a thought elaborated

EU.content: relation btwn critique & metaphysics [in Kant]: socio-pedagogic scenography, also determined thinking on right to philosophy
EU.linkedContent: relation btwn critique & metaphysics [in Kant]: socio-pedagogic scenography, also determined thinking on right to philosophy

EU.content: for Kant, the 3 places of pedagogy: 1) return to principles, coming to consciousness of metaphysics 2) theoretical instruction, indicate relation btwn moral principles & anthropological consequences 3) moral education in field of moral anthropology, conditions of application

EU.content: for Kant, pedagogy, discipline of philosophy, not purely philosophical
EU.linkedContent: for Kant, pedagogy, discipline of philosophy, not purely philosophical

FV.content: [re: Benveniste on Aristotle’s categories (see p. 416n), Freud referring to The Emperor’s New Clothes] example of illustrative jubilation, treats element of its “scientific” discourse as marvelous paradigm there to be found, happily available (disponible) for instructing discourse
